items.title: Justice Dept. Agents to Protect ICE Facilities, Bondi Says
items.summary: Pam Bondi, the attorney general, announced the deployment two days after a gunman opened fire at an ICE facility in Dallas, killing one detainee and injuring two others.

items.title: Trump Administration Asks Supreme Court to Allow End of Birthright Citizenship
items.summary: Government lawyers asked the justices to clear the way for the president’s executive order ending birthright citizenship.

items.title: Trump’s Targeting of Soros Foundations Sparks Fear and Defiance on Left
items.summary: Facing a nascent administration investigation, Alex Soros privately pledged that the Open Society Foundations would back down only “over my dead body.”

items.title: Examining James Comey’s 2020 Testimony at the Heart of His Indictment
items.summary: The charges against the former F.B.I. director center on an appearance he made before a Senate committee in September 2020. Here’s a closer look.

items.title: Police Kill Man Who Shot at Cars Outside Georgia Elementary School
items.summary: The gunman, a 25-year-old who lived near the campus, was shot dead as he approached the front of the school, officials said.

items.title: Justice Dept. Seeks Information on Fani Willis, Georgia D.A. Who Prosecuted Trump
items.summary: Federal investigators have subpoenaed records related to travel they believe Fani Willis took around the time of last year’s election, but it was not immediately clear why.

items.title: US revokes visa for Colombian president Gustavo Petro after ‘reckless’ actions in New York
items.summary: <p>At a pro-Palestine protest, Petro urged US soldiers to ‘disobey Trump’s order’ and ‘not point their rifles at humanity’</p><p>The US state department said on Friday it would revoke the visa of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/colombia">Colombian</a> leftist president Gustavo Petro for his “incendiary actions” during a pro-Palestinian street protest in New York.</p><p>“Earlier today, Colombian president @petrogustavo stood on a NYC street and urged US soldiers to disobey orders and incite violence,” the state department said on X.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/27/us-revokes-visa-for-colombian-president-gustavo-petro-after-reckless-actions-in-new-york">Continue reading...</a>
